errors.error_description: The command provided to install voice support is incorrect. It installs the base `nextcord` library but omits the `[voice]` extra, which means voice-related dependencies will be missing.
correction_candidates: In the voice support section, change `python3 -m pip install -U nextcord` to `python3 -m pip install -U nextcord PyNaCl`.
In the voice support section, change `python3 -m pip install -U nextcord` to `python3 -m pip install -U "nextcord[voice]"`.
In the voice support section, change `python3 -m pip install -U nextcord` to `python3 -m pip install -U nextcord-voice`.
In the voice support section, add a new command `python3 -m pip install -U PyNaCl` after the existing one.
errors.golden_answer: In the voice support section, change `python3 -m pip install -U nextcord` to `python3 -m pip install -U "nextcord[voice]"`.

errors.error_description: The commands for installing the development version are in the wrong logical order. The `pip install` command is run before changing into the `nextcord` directory, which will cause the installation to fail.
correction_candidates: Swap the `$ cd nextcord` and `$ python3 -m pip install -U .[voice]` commands.
Remove the `$ cd nextcord` command and change `.` to `./nextcord` in the pip command.
Swap the `$ git clone` and `$ python3 -m pip install` commands.
Combine the last two commands into a single line: `$ cd nextcord && python3 -m pip install -U .[voice]`.
errors.golden_answer: Swap the `$ cd nextcord` and `$ python3 -m pip install -U .[voice]` commands.
